nodes.bodyText: This cannot use the clearThreshold here. You can end up deleting the db could include entries that aren't in the IntSet. All we can do is iterate over the entries.
This is equivalent to new byte[] {(byte) 0xff}, it creates an array with a single byte element.
I would suggest changing this method as it is really just clearing all entries for this column family handle.
This is inherited from the old code, but using wrapIterator complicates things unnecessarily, this is in NonSegmentedRocksDBHandler so we know the iterator is always non-null.
The name doesn't sound right, because it can't delete a range, only all the entries in the column family.
The test doesn't explicitly use DeleteRange, so I'd call it testClear instead.

On the on hand, 100 keys is way too much. On the other hand, all 100 keys start with the protostream prefix + the same bytes of "key-". We need to test a key that has more 0xff bytes than the last key in our DeleteRange call.
There's already a testSegmentsRemovedAndAdded method, we should improve that, and again we don't need 100 keys.
The deprecation needs to be added in the builder and XSD as well, and the parser needs to ignore it.

afterCommit.message:
ISPN-8241 Deprecate RocksDB clearThreshold

RocksDBStore now uses DeleteRange to clear the database or a
column family.
